Venera
-
Test text.
-
History
-
The Cucuteni-Trypillians worshipped a mysterious matriarchial figure often referred to as a 'Mother Goddess' or 'Great Goddess' by archeologists. Mother Goddess' were common among ancient cultures as representing nature, fertility and the Earth itself. Very little is known about the actual Cucuteni-Trypillian pantheon and religion, other than that it was very ritualistic and complex with a heavy emphasis on often wide-hipped idols and other idols of fertility. Venera is simply the Ukrainian word for Venus, with a Venus being the name given by archeologists to prehistoric figurines representing women.
-
Leader of Trypillia
-
The Great Goddess
-
Venera
-
???
-
Welcome Barbarian, what brings you to this ancient land?
-
I am the guardian of this sacred place, tread wisely.
-
Hello travellers. What's that? You smell burning? I wouldn't worry, it's part of a ceremony.
-
Our cities burn for the last time.
-
Destroyed by patriarchial barbarians, what a suprise.
-
Your efforts to establish a patriarchy will come to nothing!
-
-
I am, astounded by your stupidity.
-
We have watched your people suffer under your leadership, it is time for change!
-
-
We are not monsters. We are not violent. But there is no other way to address our quarrels with you.
-
-
You may not understand now, but your destruction is for the best.
-
I can see you spreading patriarchy across the world
-
-
Your people have established settlements very close to our own. If we are to tolerate you, you must promise to avoid this in future,
-
